objects.name: Edited Content
objects.description:
This Technique can be used to assert that a piece of content has been published which was edited in some way without disclosure.

This technique’s sub-techniques provides analysts options for documenting different ways of editing content, and edits made to content.

Backwards Compatibility

In the 1.7 update to the DISARM Framework, the following Techniques were removed:

- T0086.003: Deceptively Edit Images (Cheap Fakes)
- T0087.002: Deceptively Edit Video (Cheap Fakes)
- T0088.002: Deceptively Edit Audio (Cheap Fakes)

Edits made to content should now be documented using T0165: Edited Content.

The format of content which was edited can be documented by combining T0165: Edited Content with T0085: Develop Text-Based Content, T0086: Develop Image-Based Content, T0087: Develop Video-Based Content, and T0088: Develop Audio-Based Content.
